evidence.source_document: Docket
evidence.text: See Dean v. Barber, 951 F.2d 1210, 1215-16 (11th Cir. 1992) (noting that "[i]t is important to distinguish suing fictitious parties from real parties sued under a fictitious name. There may be times when, for one reason or another, the plaintiff is unwilling or unable to use a party's real name. Also, one may be able to describe an individual without stating his name precisely or correctly.") (citations omitted).
